oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Turn of the century doctors
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Browder, B.B., photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Achieving Recognition
Medical profession
African American physicians; African American men
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Oval image of seven African American men wearing suits, each with a white flower in the lapel.

This posed portrait, of seven Knoxville physicians, has been hand-numbered. Second from right, in the front row, with the number "5" written on the white shirt front, is Henry Morgan Green, M.D., who practiced in Knoxville from 1900 to 1939.
